page.title: 03The Village School.
page.content: The village school was opened in 1872, it has had several names and in 1969 was given its present title of Bromesberrow St. Mary's School. It is a Church of England (Aided) School for children aged from four to eleven years. The number on roll as at September 1985 was 42. In 1968 the School was enlarged and modernised and consists of two classrooms, a hall, an office, and a kitchen. There is a large playing field and a playground. The School curriculum includes Maths, Language, Science, Humanities, Art/Craft, Music, Environmental Studies and P.E. The children have swimming lessons at Ledbury Pool. The school day is from 9am. to 3.20pm. All the children stay for lunch which is cooked on the premises.
